description:
The children have caught a mild virus and we spend all our time at home again. The youngest child loves to play with water, transfers it from different bottles to glasses, and vice versa, likes to drink this water and spit it out.

I think a lot about what self-isolation gives me. On the one hand, this is a lot of quiet time when I can do something constructive. On the other hand, since the beginning of the pandemic, we have learned very little about the world, and fears have arisen from this. I am haunted by fears of unexpected events in the outside world, accidents, for example. I have not flown by plane for a year and 9 months, and it is difficult for me to imagine how I will do it again and travel. What once gave rise to a zest for life now evokes irrational fear.
